definitions.definition: (obsolete outside law) To put an end to; to cause to cease.
To humble; to lower in status; to bring someone down physically or mentally.
To be humbled; to be brought down physically or mentally.

definitions.example: Order restrictions and prohibitions to abate an emergency situation.

definitions.definition: To reduce in amount, size, or value.
definitions.example: Legacies are liable to be abated entirely or in proportion, upon a deficiency of assets.

definitions.definition: To decrease in size, value, or amount.
To moderate; to lessen in force, intensity, to subside.
To decrease in intensity or force; to subside.

definitions.example: We will abate this price from the total.

definitions.definition: To cut away or hammer down, in such a way as to leave a figure in relief, as a sculpture, or in metalwork.
To dull the edge or point of; to blunt.
To destroy, or level to the ground.
To enter a tenement without permission after the owner has died and before the heir takes possession.
